title: Stars
summary: Stars are massive luminous spheres of plasma held together by gravity.
sample_question: What is the primary process that powers a star?

title: Planets
summary: Planets are celestial bodies orbiting stars, like Earth or Jupiter.
sample_question: What distinguishes a planet from a star?

title: Galaxies
summary: Galaxies are massive systems of stars, gas, dust, and dark matter.
sample_question: Name the galaxy we live in.

title: Black Holes
summary: Black holes are regions of spacetime with gravity so strong that nothing can escape.
sample_question: What happens to matter that crosses the event horizon?

title: Nebulae
summary: Nebulae are clouds of gas and dust in space, often forming new stars.
sample_question: What is a nebula primarily made of?

title: Pulsars
summary: Pulsars are highly magnetized, rotating neutron stars that emit beams of radiation.

title: Quasars
summary: Quasars are extremely luminous active galactic nuclei powered by supermassive black holes.

title: Comets
summary: Comets are icy bodies that release gas and dust when approaching the Sun.

title: Asteroids
summary: Asteroids are small rocky bodies orbiting the Sun, mainly in the asteroid belt.

title: Meteorites
summary: Meteorites are fragments of meteoroids that survive passing through Earth's atmosphere.
